tr.td: Known viral exanthem; Italian and Spanish cohorts described various rates of eruption
Recalcati, 2020, Sachdeva et al., 2020, Galv√°n Casas et al., 2020
Cohorts in Spain and Italy presented with an urticarial rash; many presented prior to respiratory symptoms
Tang et al., 2020, Bouaziz et al., 2020
Chickenpox-like rash observed in a diffuse pattern
Acral pernio-like lesion identified in case reports; more common in children
Kolivras et al., 2020, Recalcati et al., 2020, Recalcati, 2020, Landa et al., 2020
Case reports in the United States of transient Livedo reticularis eruption unilaterally; mechanism may be related to thrombotic state
Case report of petechial rash that can be mistaken for Dengue
Drugs used to treat COVID suspected of causing exanthems are hydroxychloroquine (morbilliform) and azithromycin (morbilliform, urticarial)
